articles.title: Pre Algebra
articles.description: Fundamental concepts before algebra: arithmetic operations, integers, fractions, decimals, ratios, proportions, percentages, and basic equations.

articles.title: Intro Discrete Math
articles.description: An introduction to fundamental concepts like logic, proofs, sets, functions, and elementary counting principles, crucial for computer science.

articles.title: Set Theory
articles.description: Exploring the properties, operations, and paradoxes of sets, providing a rigorous basis for all areas of mathematics.

articles.title: Pre Calc
articles.description: Preparation for calculus, covering advanced algebra, functions (polynomial, rational, exponential, logarithmic), trigonometry, and an introduction to limits.

articles.title: Calculus 1
articles.description: Introduction to limits, derivatives, and integrals, fundamental theorems, and applications to optimization and rates of change.

articles.title: Calculus 2
articles.description: Advanced integration techniques, applications of integrals, sequences and series, and an introduction to parametric equations and polar coordinates.

articles.title: Calculus 3
articles.description: An extension of calculus to three dimensions, covering vectors, partial derivatives, multiple integrals, and vector calculus basics.

articles.title: Multivariable Calculus
articles.description: A comprehensive study of calculus in multiple dimensions, including vector fields, line integrals, surface integrals, Green's, Stokes', and Divergence theorems.

articles.title: Linear Algebra
articles.description: Study of vectors, matrices, linear transformations, systems of linear equations, eigenvalues, and eigenvectors, essential for modern data science.

articles.title: Diff Eq
articles.description: Introduction to differential equations, their solutions, applications in science and engineering, including first-order, second-order, and systems of equations.

articles.title: Probability Theory
articles.description: Foundations of probability, including axioms, conditional probability, random variables, probability distributions, and expectation.

articles.title: Descriptive And Inferential Statistics
articles.description: Methods for summarizing data (descriptive) and drawing conclusions about populations from samples (inferential), including hypothesis testing and confidence intervals.

articles.title: Boolean Algebra And Digital Logic
articles.description: The algebra of logical operations and its application to designing digital circuits, including logic gates, truth tables, and circuit minimization.

articles.title: Combinatorics
articles.description: Techniques for counting and arranging objects, covering permutations, combinations, recurrence relations, and generating functions.

articles.title: Graph Theory
articles.description: Study of graphs and networks, including paths, cycles, trees, connectivity, and various algorithms for analyzing graph structures.

articles.title: Number Theory
articles.description: Properties and relationships of integers, prime numbers, divisibility, modular arithmetic, and Diophantine equations. Crucial for cryptography.

articles.title: Real Analysis
articles.description: Rigorous foundation for calculus, examining real numbers, sequences, series, continuity, differentiation, and integration with formal proofs.

articles.title: Abstract Algebra
articles.description: Study of algebraic structures such as groups, rings, and fields, exploring their properties and relationships through axioms and proofs.

articles.title: Galois Theory
articles.description: Connecting field theory with group theory to study the roots of polynomials, leading to proofs of the impossibility of solving quintic equations by radicals.

articles.title: Representation Theory
articles.description: The study of abstract algebraic structures by representing their elements as linear transformations of vector spaces, simplifying complex problems.

articles.title: Category Theory
articles.description: A highly abstract mathematical framework that formalizes mathematical structure and concepts in terms of categories, functors, and natural transformations.

articles.title: Complex Analysis
articles.description: Extension of calculus to complex numbers, exploring analytic functions, contour integration, residues, and series representations.

articles.title: Sampling Theory
articles.description: Techniques for selecting representative samples from a population to make inferences, including various sampling designs and estimation methods.

articles.title: Stochastic Processes And Probabilities
articles.description: Study of systems that evolve randomly over time, covering concepts like Markov chains, Poisson processes, and random walks, with applications in finance and science.

articles.title: Bayesian Statistics
articles.description: A statistical framework that uses Bayes' theorem to update the probability for a hypothesis as evidence or information becomes available.

articles.title: Statistical Learning Theory
articles.description: The theoretical foundation of machine learning, combining statistics and functional analysis to understand generalization, model complexity, and prediction.

articles.title: Lattices And Posets
articles.description: Study of partially ordered sets and lattices, exploring their algebraic structures and applications in areas like computer science and logic.

articles.title: Probabilistic Methods In Discrete Math
articles.description: Using probability theory to prove existence of discrete structures with certain properties, a powerful non-constructive technique.

articles.title: Cryptographic Primitives
articles.description: The fundamental algorithms and protocols that form the building blocks of cryptographic systems, such as hashing, encryption, and digital signatures.

articles.title: Non Euclidian Geometry
articles.description: Geometries that do not rely on Euclid's fifth postulate, such as hyperbolic and elliptic geometries, with profound implications for mathematics and physics.

articles.title: Projective Geometry
articles.description: Study of geometric properties that are invariant under projection, focusing on incidence, duality, and the concept of points at infinity.

articles.title: Fractal Geometry
articles.description: Mathematics of fractal sets, characterized by self-similarity across different scales, infinite detail, and fractional dimensions.

articles.title: Differential Geometry
articles.description: Applying calculus to study geometric properties of curves, surfaces, and manifolds in higher dimensions, fundamental to general relativity.

articles.title: Topology
articles.description: Study of topological spaces and continuous maps, focusing on properties preserved under continuous deformation, such as connectedness and compactness.

articles.title: Algebraic Geometry
articles.description: A field of mathematics studying geometric solutions of systems of polynomial equations, blending abstract algebra with geometry.
